channel.title: Alienware Laptop
channel.description:
Hey Guys!
I am looking into buying a new laptop. I have about $1000. I am thinking about an 11 inch Alienware Laptop, but don't know much about them. I want to here about them from the people who have them. Here are a couple qestions:
1. Is this laptop only good for gaming, and can it be used for like typing homework, and just making server for moparscape? 2. Are these durable? 3. Do they have A LOT of hard drive space in them (for all my games) 4. What would you give them overall?
If you guys can only answer the first one, that is what I am mainly focused on. But if you don't like alienware, and you know any good laptops that work great with gaming, school work, and just messing around (runescape, moparscape) please reply too.
THANKS!
*I JUST RELIEZED THIS WAS IN THE WRONG SECTION*

item.title: Alienware Laptop
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Well the problem is I only have 600 dollars, and to get the other 500 I have to trade my laptop in where I bought it (or if there is any place that will take laptops and give you money for them please tell me), and they don’t have any dell computers there. There is a sony VAIO on that website if those things are good.

Read full topic

item.title: Alienware Laptop
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:23, topic:341351”][quote author=b b0yz 4 link=topic=437748.msg3217436#msg3217436 date=1274822398]
Like company of heroes, sims 3, Age of Empires, Empire Total war. Those kinds of games. And I am mainly focused on server building on this laptop so if there are any good ones on that website that will support a large server with a bunch of people that would be amazing.

And Frell I don’t have 1200 dollars lol.

http://www.officemax.com/technology/computers/laptop-computers-and-tablet-pcs/product-prod2850235?history=xxk6mv1u|categoryId~10004^categoryName~technology^parentCategoryID~category_root^prodPage~25^region~1@avkmuiqv|categoryId~283^categoryName~computers^parentCategoryID~cat_10004^prodPage~25^region~1^refine~1@2yx76uox|prodPage~15^refine~1^region~1^categoryName~laptop-computers-and-tablet-pcs^categoryId~325^parentCategoryID~cat_283@3f53tvoa|refineName~Price^prodPage~15^refine~1^sub_attr_name~2^region~1^refineValue~849+<%3D++<%3D+999.99

What do you all think about this one?
[/quote]

Well, the processor, and the graphics card let that one down. Plus, is that even a laptop? I’m not sure.

I still think the Dell’s are best for gaming and general high graphical performance, google “gaming laptops” and they’re the first result…
I can’t look at the American site so I can’t look to see what’s the best one for your budget in dollars, but I highly recommend the Studio 17, it has amazing speakers as I’ve found. ;)[/quote]
Dell M1530 the way to go [i got it long ago :rolleyes: ]

Read full topic

I can’t look at the American site so I can’t look to see what’s the best one for your budget in dollars, but I highly recommend the Studio 17, it has amazing speakers as I’ve found.

Um, none of them would be too great. Although it depends, what kind of games would you want to be playing?
And I would suggest that you look into desktops, you can get so much more for your money, unless of course you need a laptop for a particular reason, school work?

item.title: Alienware Laptop
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I recently got a new laptop, and I did look at the Alienware’s, as I’ve always wanted one, but looking at it then, you’re basically paying for the design.
And you do know 11" is tiny, right?

I suggest one of the higher end Dell laptops, but not Alienware.
I eventually decided on the high range Dell Studio 17, which cost me £770, Intel i5 quad core processor running at 2.53ghz, 4GB RAM, and the ATI Radeon HD5650 graphics card. So far, it’s done everything I’ve wanted it to, yes I game a lot, and do 3d design renderings and it copes with them all fine. Games such as Left for Dead 2, RuneScape, WoW, Colin Mcrae DiRT, Unreal Tournament 3 and the Need for Speed series, can all be played at max settings with no lagg whatsoever, and it is capable of running any game, but possibly at a slightly lower setting to increase framerate.

Take a look at this, if you’re willing to spend $1000~: http://www1.euro.dell.com/uk/en/business/4x_studio_xps_16/fs.aspx?refid=4x_studio_xps_16&s=bsd&cs=ukbsdt1

Or even my one, here: http://www1.euro.dell.com/uk/en/home/Laptops/studio-1747/pd.aspx?refid=studio-1747&s=dhs&cs=ukdhs1&ST=dell%20studio%2017&dgc=ST&cid=41141&lid=1069630&acd=124047435420569

Read full topic

item.title: Alienware Laptop
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

alien ware is highly over priced no doubt there GREAT computers but i dunno. you could get a little bit less of a good computer for about 250 dollars less haha

but yes ive USED these computers before at my friends house and

  1. games run smooth

we were playing empires and hit max capacity and no lag at all it was great but internet and all that other good stuff was fine i guess? nothing bad about it

  1. its heavy bro. well at least my friends was. so i hope it is i dont know about that one

  2. hell yeah a lot

  3. 8/10 but the price is what brought it down

btw - they look so cool. they light up and shit its pretty neat

Read full topic
